campaigns.title: The Cabin Stalkings
campaigns.premise: Detective Mills investigates a series of disappearances at remote cabins in the woods. The evidence points to a pattern... but what's really hunting these victims?

narrative.before: Detective Mills: 'The evidence bags are scattered across my desk. Three victims, three cabins... I need to piece together what was found at each scene before I can understand the pattern...'
narrative.after: Detective Mills: 'Interesting. All the same types of weapons, all the same victim profiles. But these coffee orders... they're personal. Someone was watching them, studying them...'

narrative.before: Detective Mills: 'The forensic report just came in. Prints everywhere at the crime scenes. But these aren't random - there's a pattern in the types of fingerprints being left behind...'
narrative.after: Detective Mills: 'Loop, whorl, arch, composite... all four types found. But that's impossible. One person doesn't have all four types of fingerprints. Unless...'

narrative.before: Detective Mills: 'I found this in the evidence locker. More tools were recovered than listed in the official report. Someone's hiding something...'
narrative.after: Detective Mills: 'Swab, tape, light, bag... standard forensic tools. But these horror movie weapons... they match the MO of a killer from 20 years ago. The Butcher of Blackwood Cabin.'

narrative.before: Detective Mills: 'I'm at the fourth cabin. The security footage shows someone was here 20 minutes ago. I have limited time to gather evidence before they return...'
narrative.after: Detective Mills: 'I barely got out with the evidence. Serial, mass, spree, vigilante... the killer's profile is becoming clear. And these forest sounds... I heard them all while I was escaping.'

narrative.before: Detective Mills: 'Back at the station, going through cold case files. The Butcher of Blackwood Cabin was never caught. But these files... they contain references to something darker...'
narrative.after: Detective Mills: 'Dark room, dark water, dark forest, dark soul... the pattern emerges. The killer doesn't just stalk cabins. They hunt in places of darkness. And I just got a call about another cabin...'

campaigns.epilogue: Detective Mills: 'The Cabin Stalkings case... closed? No. Never closed. There are more cabins. More victims. More darkness. But now I understand the pattern. Now I can start hunting back...'

campaigns.title: The Midnight Broadcast
campaigns.premise: Reporter Jane receives a pirate TV signal that only appears at midnight. Each broadcast contains a puzzle - solve it, or the next victim dies. Can she decode the signal and stop the killer?

narrative.before: Reporter Jane: 'The broadcast just started. Static, then a message: "Find what doesn't belong." I need to analyze what I'm seeing before it's too late...'
narrative.after: Reporter Jane: 'The groups are connected. But what's the message hidden in these connections? There must be something I'm missing...'

campaigns.epilogue: Reporter Jane: 'The signal has been decoded. But the killer... they're still out there. Watching. Broadcasting. Waiting for midnight...'

campaigns.title: The Archive
campaigns.premise: Archivist discovers forbidden texts that drive readers to madness. Each text contains a puzzle - solve it to seal the text away, or succumb to its influence.

narrative.before: Archivist: 'I found this book in the restricted section. It says: "Only those who can separate the threads of knowledge may read further." The pages are filled with scattered words...'
narrative.after: Archivist: 'The words are connected by unseen threads. But I can feel something watching from between the pages...'

campaigns.epilogue: Archivist: 'The archive has been cleansed. But the texts... they're not destroyed. Just sealed. For now. Another archivist will come. Another will be tempted. The cycle continues...'
